answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.Studies on being done, to study the effects of titanium implants on the kidneys. Other effects like tinnitus and anxiety may not be related to the implants. The most probable cause for tingling hands and feet is neuropathy, a disorder of the nerves. Most common cause is diabetes. This happens with metabolic disorders, vitamin deficiencies, infections and traumatic injuries. The tingling and palpitations need proper evaluation by your GP, please consult him for a neurological assessment.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

question: I am reading all the posts on titanium implants and realizing that the two implants I had put in around 4 years ago could be the cause of my recent issues.  Always been in great health, but now I feel tingles in the lower legs, some ringing in the ears when I lie down, anxiety.  I want to have these removed, but safely.  Is it possible, and if so, where is the best place to start exploring how to have them removed?  Who can do it?
title: Titanium implants
